description: Demonstration of ComplianceSense automatically fetching a new EU AI Act provision, parsing it, cross‑referencing against internal controls, summarizing the impact, storing the update, and sending a concise Slack alert to the legal team.

messages.content: You are ComplianceSense, an autonomous compliance‑monitoring assistant. Use the available tools to fetch regulatory updates, parse them, compare with internal controls, summarize impacts, store records, and generate alerts for the appropriate stakeholders.
Please alert the legal department about the newly published EU AI Act provision that affects model deployment.
Sure, I will retrieve the latest items from the EU AI Act feed to locate the new provision.

[{"title":"EU AI Act – Provision on High‑Risk AI Model Deployment","link":"https://eu-ai-act.org/documents/provision-high-risk-deployment.pdf","published_date":"2025-11-30","summary":"Adds new obligations for providers of high‑risk AI models regarding pre‑deployment conformity assessment and post‑deployment monitoring."}]
I have found the relevant provision. I will now download and parse the full text of the document.

arguments.content:
### EU AI Act – Provision on High‑Risk AI Model Deployment

**Article 5‑1 – Scope**
Providers of high‑risk AI models must conduct a conformity assessment before placing the model in the EU market.

**Article 5‑2 – Documentation**
A technical dossier describing the model's intended purpose, training data, and risk mitigation measures must be maintained.

**Article 5‑3 – Post‑deployment Monitoring**
Continuous monitoring for adverse outcomes is mandatory, with a requirement to report significant incidents within 24 hours.

**Effective Date**: 2026‑01‑01

Next, I will compare these new clauses with your internal controls to see what is already covered and where gaps exist.

A technical dossier describing the model's intended purpose, training data, and risk mitigation measures must be maintained.
Continuous monitoring for adverse outcomes is mandatory, with a requirement to report significant incidents within 24 hours.

internal_controls.description: AI Model Governance Policy – defines approval workflow and documentation requirements.
Data Privacy Impact Assessment – ensures personal data handling complies with GDPR.
Incident Management Procedure – outlines reporting and escalation for operational incidents.

I have identified two matches and one gap. I will now generate a concise business‑focused summary of the changes.

changes.text: Providers of high‑risk AI models must conduct a conformity assessment before placing the model in the EU market.
A technical dossier describing the model's intended purpose, training data, and risk mitigation measures must be maintained.
Continuous monitoring for adverse outcomes is mandatory, with a requirement to report significant incidents within 24 hours.

messages.content:
The EU AI Act now requires:
• A pre‑deployment conformity assessment for high‑risk AI models (Art.5‑1). 
• A comprehensive technical dossier covering purpose, training data, and risk mitigation (Art.5‑2). 
• Ongoing post‑deployment monitoring and a 24‑hour incident reporting window (Art.5‑3). 
Impact: Your existing AI Model Governance Policy aligns with the conformity assessment and monitoring requirements, but you lack a formal technical dossier process. A gap‑closing action is needed to create/extend the dossier procedure.
I will store this regulation update for audit purposes before notifying the legal team.

arguments.content: Full text of EU AI Act provision on high‑risk AI model deployment (see parsed clauses above).

messages.content: Update stored (record‑2025‑00042). Now I will send a Slack alert to the legal department.

arguments.title: EU AI Act – New Provision on High‑Risk AI Model Deployment (Effective 2026‑01‑01)
arguments.body:
## Summary of Change
- **Conformity assessment** required before model launch (Art.5‑1).
- **Technical dossier** must detail purpose, training data, risk mitigation (Art.5‑2).
- **Post‑deployment monitoring** with 24‑hour incident reporting (Art.5‑3).

## Impact on Current Controls
- **Matches:** AI Model Governance Policy (covers assessment & monitoring).
- **Gap:** No formal technical dossier process – action required.

## Recommended Action
1. Draft a Technical Dossier SOP covering the new requirements.
2. Review the draft with the AI engineering team by **15 Feb 2026**.
3. Update the AI Model Governance Policy to reference the new SOP.

*Record ID:* `record-2025-00042`

messages.content: Alert sent to legal@company.com via email and Slack user U12345.

✅ The legal team has been notified with a detailed summary and recommended next steps. Let me know if you need anything else, such as scheduling a compliance review meeting or tracking the implementation of the technical dossier.
